rules.title: How to Play 3-5-8 (Sergeant Major) ğŸƒ
rules.intro: ğŸ‘¥ The game is played by 3 players using a standard 52-card deck ranked A, K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2. Cards are dealt and played counterclockwise.
rules.deal: Each player is dealt 16 cards. The last 4 cards are placed face down as the kitty.
rules.goal: Each player must try to win a set number of tricks, depending on their position:
rules.postDeal: After dealing, there is a declaration phase, card exchange, and kitty swap.
rules.declare1: The player aiming for 8 tricks (first to play) must choose and declare the trump suit.
rules.declare2: Declarations: spades, hearts, clubs, diamonds, no trump, and pass. Each can pass only once per game.
rules.declare3: If the dealer passes, cards are redealt with the same player order.
rules.swap1: No card exchange in the first round.
rules.swap2: In subsequent rounds, any player who scored '+' gives a card for each point to a player with '-'.
rules.swap3: If the '-' player has a higher card in the requested suit, they must return their highest card in that suit. Otherwise, they return the card received.
rules.swap4: If two players are '+', the player with the higher quota exchanges first.
rules.swap5: No exchange when 'no trump' is declared.
rules.kitty: The 4 kitty cards must be shown to all. The player with an objective of 8 takes the kitty and then returns any 4 cards face down (others do not see the returned cards).
rules.play1: Play is counterclockwise. The player aiming for 8 tricks starts.
rules.play2: Next hands: winner of previous trick leads.
rules.play3: First card can be any suit. Following players must follow suit. If they can't but have trump, they must play a trump. Otherwise, any card.
rules.play4: If the led suit is not trump, no need to play a stronger card.
rules.play5: If led suit is trump, players must play a higher trump if possible, else a lower one, else any card.
rules.play6: If the second player trumps and the third can't follow suit, the third must play a stronger trump if possible.
rules.play7: Trick is won by the highest trump, or if no trump, by the highest led suit.
rules.play8: In no trump, just follow suitâ€”no trumping.
rules.scoring1: After all 16 tricks, compare actual tricks won to the target for each player:
rules.scoring2: More than target: +1 for each extra trick.
rules.scoring3: Fewer than target: -1 for each missing trick.
rules.scoring4: Example: Target 3, win 5: +2 points. Target 3, win 1: -2 points.
rules.end1: Game ends after 9 deals. Winner is the player with the highest score.
rules.end2: If tied, winner is the one with more points in the last deal.
rules.end3: If all are tied, the last deal winner wins.
rules.end4: If two are tied, the most recent deal winner wins.
